name: middle row
tips: Ensure proper finger placement on the home row keys (ASDF for the left hand, JKL; for the right hand).
Practice touch typing to build muscle memory and improve speed.
Maintain a relaxed hand position and straight wrists to prevent strain.

name: top row
tips: Adjust your keyboard and chair height for an ergonomic typing setup.
Start with slower typing speeds to focus on accuracy before increasing speed.
Patience and persistence will lead to improvement on the top row.

name: bottom row
tips: Practice finger stretching to reach the bottom row keys without strain.
Utilize your thumbs for the space bar, allowing fingers to focus on bottom row keys.
Keep fingers relaxed while typing to avoid tension and fatigue.

name: little finger
tips: Keep your little finger relaxed and close to the keys.
Use proper hand positioning to reach the keys comfortably.
Practice typing slowly at first, then gradually increase your speed.

name: Ring Finger
tips: Position your fingers correctly on the home row keys.
Keep your wrists straight to avoid strain.
Practice accuracy before speed.

name: Middle Finger
tips: Maintain a light touch on the keys to prevent fatigue.
Focus on using the correct finger for each key.
Take regular breaks to stretch your fingers and wrists.

name: Index Finger
tips: Practice proper finger placement to improve accuracy.
Use a typing tutor program to track your progress.
Stay patient and consistent with your practice.
